greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (1-x)/(1+6x-3x^2).
comment: The g.f. is the transform of the g.f. of A002605 under the mapping G(x)-> (-1/(1+x))G((x-1)/(x+1)). In general this mapping transforms x/(1-kx-kx^2) into (1-x)/(1+2(k+1)x-(2k-1)x^2).
For n >= 1, |a(n)| equals the numbers of words of length n-1 on alphabet {0,1,...,6} containing no subwords 00, 11, 22, 33. - _Milan Janjic_, Jan 31 2015
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (-6,3).
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Oct 27 2004
